# CMTremorResult

**Class**

A result object that contains data about the presence and strength of tremors during a one-minute interval.

## Declaration

```swift
class CMTremorResult
```

## Overview

The following equation is always true: [doc://com.apple.coremotion/documentation/CoreMotion/CMTremorResult/percentUnknown] `+` [doc://com.apple.coremotion/documentation/CoreMotion/CMTremorResult/percentNone] `+` [doc://com.apple.coremotion/documentation/CoreMotion/CMTremorResult/percentSlight] `+` [doc://com.apple.coremotion/documentation/CoreMotion/CMTremorResult/percentMild] `+` [doc://com.apple.coremotion/documentation/CoreMotion/CMTremorResult/percentModerate] `+` [doc://com.apple.coremotion/documentation/CoreMotion/CMTremorResult/percentStrong] `= 1.0`.

## Reading the Time Interval

- **startDate**: The result’s start time and date.
- **endDate**: The result’s end time and date.

## Accessing Tremor Data

- **percentUnknown**: The percentage of time when the algorithm couldn’t make a determination.
- **percentNone**: The percentage of time when no tremor was detected.
- **percentSlight**: The percentage of time when a tremor was likely, and the displacement amplitude was slight.
- **percentMild**: The percentage of time when a tremor was likely, and the displacement amplitude was mild.
- **percentModerate**: The percentage of time when a tremor was likely, and the displacement amplitude was moderate.
- **percentStrong**: The percentage of time when a tremor was likely, and the displacement amplitude was strong.

## Movement disorder

- **Getting movement disorder symptom data**: Retrieve data from the Apple Watch’s movement disorder manager.
- **Adhering to the movement disorder data collection requirements**: Ensure that your users understand and have control over the data your app collects.
- **Movement disorder algorithm changelog**: A chronological log of notable changes to the movement disorder algorithm.
- **CMMovementDisorderManager**: A manager for recording and querying movement disorder data.
- **CMDyskineticSymptomResult**: A result object that contains data about the likely presence of dyskinetic symptoms during a one-minute interval.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
- NSSecureCoding
